headline: Ground Chicken Burgers
description: These flavorful burgers made with ground chicken, Parmesan cheese, and garlic will keep you grilling from spring to fall.
name: Ground Chicken Burgers
recipeIngredient: 1.5 teaspoons coarse sea salt, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
Place bread crumbs, onion, garlic, Parmesan cheese, salt, paprika, black pepper, and cayenne pepper into the bowl of a food processor; pulse until blended.

Combine chicken, egg, and bread crumb mixture in a large bowl until evenly mixed. Divide and shape mixture into 4 equal patties. Place on a cookie sheet and cover with aluminum foil. Refrigerate for 5 to 10 minutes.

Cook patties on the preheated grill until cooked through, at least 7 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the patties should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I liked it and made the recipe as directed. I cooked them in a nonstick pan instead of on a grill. My only comment is they were a little salty. Iâ€™ll reduce salt next time.
Not bad but I changed a couple of things- no breadcrumbs, using shredded taco cheese, and no egg. They stayed together quite well and were nicely juicy.
Made this for my hubby and he loved them. Made exactly as shown.
I made two; only ate one. They were too dry.
Great tasting. We loved it. I only added 3/4 of a cup of bread crumbs. It made 4 really great size chicken burgers. Will make again for sure!

These were really good for chicken burgers, which normally tend to dry out. The only change I made was to use less bread crumbs (2/3 cup instead of 1 cup) because I don't like the spongy texture which results from too much binder. I really liked the method of mixing the onion, garlic, breadcrumbs together in the food processor. I didn't cook as long as directed as 7 minutes per side would definitely dry these out. I topped the patties with guacamole, cheddar and bacon. Yum!
